headline: CCS students participate in YLA Statehouse experience
author: BELLEFONTAINE EXAMINER STAFF
sentences: According to YLA’s website, students will “experience the process of state government by preparing and then presenting legislation in the actual House or Senate Chambers, make decisions to move Ohio and West Virginia forward, create connections with peers and adults from across our state, and have a great time with a purpose.

The nine legislative students wrote and submitted bills individually or with partners, presented these bills to committees, and one student’s bill, created by Brooklyn Horner, passed the student House of Representatives.
These youth representatives, with Amy LeCrone as their adviser, spent three days learning first-hand how state government works by participating in this student-led government simulation.
Fellow CCS students who participated included Lucy Jarvis, Liam Meiring, Caleb King, Gabe Salmonowicz, Isabel Schmidt, Anna Kratz, Hannah Marlow, Liliana Printz and Karlie Penhorwood.
A group of 10 high school students from Calvary Christian School attended the YLA Youth in Government event earlier this month at the Ohio Statehouse in Columbus.
“Make friends, learn all you can, put your best ideas forward, and make differences for good now and throughout your life.”
Nine of these students attended as state legislators, and one student attended as a page.
Governor Mike DeWine also spoke to the group on Friday morning.
Liliana served as a co-chair of committee three.
